thread.title: H.S. boys soccer: Tenafly edges out Ridgewood
thread.title_full: H.S. boys soccer: Tenafly edges out Ridgewood

title: H.S. boys soccer: Tenafly edges out Ridgewood
text:
H.S. boys soccer: Tenafly edges out Ridgewood October 12, 2015 Last updated: Monday, October 12, 2015, 1:21 AM The Record Print 
Seth Shachar, Andrew Hwang, Ofek Nahar and Matt Weiss each scored in the penalty kick shootout for Tenafly as the Tigers prevailed, 4-3, over Ridgewood, in that portion after a 2-2 tie through regulation and two overtimes in a Bergen County tournament boys soccer round of 16 game Sunday in Emerson. 
Third-seeded Tenafly (7-0-1) had forced overtime when, trailing 2-1, the Tigers scored with 30 seconds remaining on a goal by Andres Morales off an assist by Nahar. 
Kodai Ueyama scored off an assist from Romero Morales in the first half for Tenafly, and Nicholas Bigger (first half) and Dean Anzalone (second half) had the goals for the 14th-seeded Maroons. 
BERGEN TECH 1, CLIFFSIDE PARK 0 (at Emerson): Daniel Ryvkin scored off an assist from Michael Ozga nine minutes into the game to send the second-seeded Knights past the 15th-seeded Red Raiders. Brandon Duffy made 10 saves for the shutout for Bergen Tech, which will play Northern Highlands in the BCT quarterfinals this Sunday. 
NORTHERN HIGHLANDS 1, WALDWICK 0 (at Emerson): Senior center halfback Nick Friedland scored a goal off an assist from Francesco D’Iorio in the second half to propel the 10th-seeded Highlanders past the seventh-seeded Warriors. Jase Barrack had four saves for Northern Highlands for the shutout and Erik Neugebauer had 14 saves for Waldwick. 
RAMAPO 5, MAHWAH 0 (at Franklin Lakes): Noah Kilday, Charlie Ortiz and Dylan Rocchio each had a goal and assist to lift the fourth-seeded Green Raiders past the 13th-seeded Thunderbirds. Colin Nelson and Conor Young combined for five saves for the Ramapo shutout. 
GARFIELD 4, PASCACK HILLS 1 (at Emerson): Jorge Salas scored two goals and Oscar Sanchez had a goal and an assist to move the sixth-seeded Boilermakers past the 11th-seeded Cowboys. Garfield took a 3-1 halftime lead and Egi Zyfi (seven) and Jose Juarez (one) combined for eight saves for the Boilermakers. Stephano Gikas scored the Pascack Hills goal and Evan Lazarus made nine saves for the Cowboys. 
BERGEN CATHOLIC 3, PARK RIDGE 0 (at Franklin Lakes): Junior forward Cole Bosch scored three goals to spark the top-seeded Crusaders past the 16th-seeded Owls. Miles Franklyn had two assists for Bergen Catholic and Nick VaFiadis (four) and Dash Coyle (two) combined for six saves for the Crusaders. 
PASCACK VALLEY 3, RAMSEY 0 (at Franklin Lakes): The eighth-seeded Indians scored one first-half goal and two goals in the second half against the ninth-seeded Rams to advance to a quarterfinal meeting with Bergen Catholic on Sunday. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
